rows.story_text:
How many cats? 

 0 Zero cats.

No cats here!

story_text.eng:
How many cats? 

 0 Zero cats.

No cats here!

annotation_1.eng: 0 is an important number! It's where all counting starts, even when we don't say it.

annotation_2.eng: How many cats do you see?

annotation_3.eng: Count together the butterflies – they are tricky to find in this picture.

rows.annotation_1: 0 is an important number! It's where all counting starts, even when we don't say it.
rows.annotation_2: How many cats do you see?
rows.annotation_3: Count together the butterflies – they are tricky to find in this picture.

rows.story_text:
How many cats? 

 1 One cat.

 A black cat is eating red meat.

story_text.eng:
How many cats? 

 1 One cat.

 A black cat is eating red meat.

annotation_1.eng: Point to and name the green and orange squares, blue shirt, and black cat.

annotation_2.eng: Notice how Paul is looking at the cat. Paul sure likes cats!

annotation_3.eng: Each time a cat is added: a) say that one more than the last number of cats is the new number, and b) one less than the current number is the last number.

rows.annotation_1: Point to and name the green and orange squares, blue shirt, and black cat.
rows.annotation_2: Notice how Paul is looking at the cat. Paul sure likes cats!
rows.annotation_3: Each time a cat is added: a) say that one more than the last number of cats is the new number, and b) one less than the current number is the last number.

rows.story_text:
How many cats? 

 2 Two cats. 

 A white cat and a grey cat are sleeping.

story_text.eng:
How many cats? 

 2 Two cats. 

 A white cat and a grey cat are sleeping.

annotation_1.eng: Count together the cats, plants, and people.

annotation_2.eng: Of cats, plants, and people, which number is the biggest? Which one is the smallest?

annotation_3.eng: Notice that the square tiles are now all the same gray color.

rows.annotation_1: Count together the cats, plants, and people.
rows.annotation_2: Of cats, plants, and people, which number is the biggest? Which one is the smallest?
rows.annotation_3: Notice that the square tiles are now all the same gray color.

rows.story_text:
How many cats? 

3 Three cats. 

Three cats are playing in the kitchen.

story_text.eng:
How many cats? 

3 Three cats. 

Three cats are playing in the kitchen.

annotation_1.eng: What a mess! There must be zero people here!

annotation_2.eng: Count together each group – the cats, cabinet doors, food containers, and spoons.

annotation_3.eng: Which thing is there the most of in this picture?

rows.annotation_1: What a mess! There must be zero people here!
rows.annotation_2: Count together each group – the cats, cabinet doors, food containers, and spoons.
rows.annotation_3: Which thing is there the most of in this picture?

rows.story_text:
How many cats? 

4 Four cats. 

Four cats are Paul's friends.

story_text.eng:
How many cats? 

4 Four cats. 

Four cats are Paul's friends.

annotation_2.eng: Which of these cats have you seen before, and which are new? Which ones are missing?

annotation_3.eng: Point at and name all the different colors in the room.

rows.annotation_2: Which of these cats have you seen before, and which are new? Which ones are missing?
rows.annotation_3: Point at and name all the different colors in the room.

rows.story_text:
How many cats? 

5 Five cats. 

Five cats chase the dog.

story_text.eng:
How many cats? 

5 Five cats. 

Five cats chase the dog.

annotation_1.eng: Looking at their faces and bodies, do the cats and the dog like each other?

annotation_2.eng: Count the number of cats and the number of dogs. Which group is bigger? Poor dog!

annotation_3.eng: These cats all have different coloring. Describe the color and pattern of each cat.

rows.annotation_1: Looking at their faces and bodies, do the cats and the dog like each other?
rows.annotation_2: Count the number of cats and the number of dogs. Which group is bigger? Poor dog!
rows.annotation_3: These cats all have different coloring. Describe the color and pattern of each cat.

rows.story_text:
How many cats?

6 Six cats.

Six cats waiting for the dog.

story_text.eng:
How many cats?

6 Six cats.

Six cats waiting for the dog.

annotation_1.eng: Count the cats on the floor and in the picture. Is it the same number?

annotation_2.eng: Find a cat or two in the picture on the wall that is not on the floor.

annotation_3.eng: The dog doesn't want to come back. Why not?

rows.annotation_1: Count the cats on the floor and in the picture. Is it the same number?
rows.annotation_2: Find a cat or two in the picture on the wall that is not on the floor.
rows.annotation_3: The dog doesn't want to come back. Why not?

rows.story_text:
How many cats? 

7 Seven cats. 

Seven cats playing in the compound.

story_text.eng:
How many cats? 

7 Seven cats. 

Seven cats playing in the compound.

annotation_1.eng: Point at each of the seven cats.

annotation_3.eng: The cat on the roof is the highest cat. How did that cat get up so high?

rows.annotation_1: Point at each of the seven cats.
rows.annotation_3: The cat on the roof is the highest cat. How did that cat get up so high?

rows.story_text:
How many cats? 

8 Eight cats. 

Eight cats and one dog!

story_text.eng:
How many cats? 

8 Eight cats. 

Eight cats and one dog!

annotation_1.eng: The cats have many different colors and patterns. Have you seen cats like these?

annotation_2.eng: Seven cats plus one dog makes how many animals?

annotation_3.eng: Do you think the dog looks happy or worried?

rows.annotation_1: The cats have many different colors and patterns. Have you seen cats like these?
rows.annotation_2: Seven cats plus one dog makes how many animals?
rows.annotation_3: Do you think the dog looks happy or worried?

rows.story_text:
A kitten is stuck in a tree! 

"I will rescue you!" says Paul.

story_text.eng:
A kitten is stuck in a tree! 

"I will rescue you!" says Paul.

annotation_1.eng: How many cats are stuck in the tree?

annotation_2.eng: How did the cat get up there?

annotation_3.eng: The cat is higher than Paul. How will Paul help the cat?

rows.annotation_1: How many cats are stuck in the tree?
rows.annotation_2: How did the cat get up there?
rows.annotation_3: The cat is higher than Paul. How will Paul help the cat?

rows.story_text:
Mama, can we keep him?" 

How many cats? 

9 Nine cats. 

"That is too many cats!" says Mama.

story_text.eng:
Mama, can we keep him?" 

How many cats? 

9 Nine cats. 

"That is too many cats!" says Mama.

annotation_1.eng: One more than eight cats is nine cats. A dog and nine cats is how many animals?

annotation_2.eng: Do you know anyone with cats? How many cats do they have?

annotation_3.eng: Do you think nine cats is too many?

rows.annotation_1: One more than eight cats is nine cats. A dog and nine cats is how many animals?
rows.annotation_2: Do you know anyone with cats? How many cats do they have?
rows.annotation_3: Do you think nine cats is too many?
